bug.short_desc: Large Context menus are cut off at browser window edges

long_desc.thetext: A context menu with a large amount of menu items is cut off at the edges of the browser window. It would be desirable to scroll down to the obscured menu items or make them otherwise available.
Created attachment 268 Screenshot
Maybe this would be a nice feature when the new layout engine is ready.

We are not able to provide a general solution in 0.7, which works out of the box in all cases but It is possible to get this working in a controlled environment with a custom menu class.
Check the attached demo, how to do it.
A general solution will have to wait until 0.8.
Created attachment 289 Menu example with automatic scrollbars
As this will be post 0.8 this is no dependency for #865 anymore.
untarget. Not to be addressed for 0.8.2.
to Jonny
Accepted.
The Menu should rather use a SlideBar than the native overflow for scrolling.

What's about to put this complexity into a separate class? Seems to be a bit to much overhead for a general menu solution.
* Where in the world we have really scrollbars in menus? * Is this way intuitive? * What's about the Apple way of putting an arrow at the end and beginning which do the scrolling?
I agree with Sebastian. I have never seen any scroll bars in a menu, but arrows at the top and bottom for scrolling. So I would prefer arrows instead of scroll bars.
That is why I said we should use a SlideBar to implement the scrolling mechanism. I found two examples of how this could look like: OS X and Office XP.
Created attachment 484 A select box with scrollbars in OS X.
Created attachment 485 A menu with scrollbars in Office XP.
Out of 0.9 timeframe.
to Fabian as discussed
accept

An OSX like overflow handling is implemented now.
r20325
mass renaming of 0.9 target to 1.0-beta1
